tts: パーティーわ たのしい です
prompt: Imagine a group of people laughing and dancing at a party, having a good time.
fact: This sentence uses the topic marker 'は' to emphasize that it's the party that is fun.

tts: ともだち と パーティー わ たのしい です
prompt: Picture yourself and your friends at a party, enjoying each other's company and having a blast.
fact: This sentence highlights that the fun is specifically derived from being with friends at the party.

tts: ともだち と たべもの わ たのしい です
prompt: Imagine a group of friends sharing a meal together, laughing and enjoying the food and each other's company.
fact: This sentence implies that the act of eating becomes more enjoyable when shared with friends.

tts: たべもの わ おいしい です
prompt: Imagine someone taking a bite of food and their eyes widening with delight at the taste.
fact: This is a simple statement praising the quality of the food.

tts: パーティー の たべもの わ おいしい です
prompt: Think of a buffet table at a party, filled with tempting and delicious-looking snacks and dishes.
fact: This sentence specifically refers to the food served at a party.

tts: パーティー の のみもの わ おいしい です
prompt: Imagine a table with a variety of colorful and refreshing drinks being served at a party.
fact: This sentence refers to the drinks served at a party, implying they are tasty.

tts: のみもの わ たくさん  あり ます
english: There are a lot of drinks.
prompt: Visualize a table overflowing with various bottles and glasses of drinks.
fact: This sentence uses the verb 'あります' (arimasu) to indicate the existence of many drinks.

tts: たべもの わ たくさん  あり ます
english: There is a lot of food.
prompt: Picture a table laden with plates piled high with different kinds of food.
fact: Similar to the previous sentence, this one uses 'あります' to express the abundance of food.

tts: ともだち わ たくさん  い ます
english: There are a lot of friends.
prompt: Imagine a room filled with many people, all friends with each other, chatting and laughing.
fact: This sentence uses 'います' (imasu) instead of 'あります' because it refers to the existence of people (friends).

tts: パーティー わ にぎやか です
prompt: Hear the sounds of music, chatter, and laughter coming from a party, indicating a vibrant and energetic atmosphere.
fact: This sentence describes the party's atmosphere as lively and bustling.

tts: パーティー わ たのしい です か
prompt: Imagine someone asking their friend if they are having a good time at the party.
fact: Adding 'か' at the end of a sentence turns it into a question.

tts: たべもの わ おいしい です か
prompt: Picture someone taking a bite of food and then asking their friend if they like it too.
fact: This is a common question to ask when trying something for the first time.

tts: のみもの わ すき です か
prompt: Imagine someone offering you a drink and asking if it's to your taste.
fact: This question asks about someone's preference regarding the drinks.

tts: ともだち わ い ます か
prompt: This question can be sensitive, but imagine someone asking if you have people you consider friends.
fact: This question uses 'います' because it's asking about the existence of people (friends).

tts: パーティー わ どこ です か
prompt: Imagine someone looking for the location of a party, asking for directions.
fact: This is a straightforward question asking for the party's location.

tts: あした わ パーティー が  あり ます
prompt: Think of a calendar with 'party' marked on the next day.
fact: This sentence uses 'が' (ga) because it's introducing the party as the subject.

tts: あした わ ともだち と あ い ます
prompt: Imagine making plans with friends to meet up the next day.
fact: This sentence implies a future action (meeting friends) using the present tense form of the verb.

tts: あした わ たべもの を たくさん  たべ ます
english: I will eat a lot of food tomorrow.
prompt: Imagine looking forward to a big meal the next day, perhaps at a buffet or a feast.
fact: This sentence uses 'を' (wo) to mark the object of the verb '食べる' (taberu - to eat).

tts: あした わ のみもの を たくさん  のみ ます
english: I will drink a lot of drinks tomorrow.
prompt: Think of someone planning to enjoy various beverages at an event the next day.
fact: This sentence uses 'を' to mark the object of the verb '飲む' (nomu - to drink).

tts: あした わ たのしい です
prompt: Imagine looking forward to an enjoyable day tomorrow, filled with anticipated activities.
fact: This sentence expresses excitement and anticipation for the next day.

tts: きのう わ パーティー でした
prompt: Think of waking up with memories of attending a party the day before.
fact: This sentence uses the past tense 'でした' (deshita) to indicate the party happened yesterday.

tts: きのう わ ともだち と あ い ました
prompt: Imagine reminiscing about spending time with friends the previous day.
fact: This sentence describes a past action (meeting friends) using the past tense form of the verb.

tts: きのう わ たべもの を たくさん  たべ まし た
english: I ate a lot of food yesterday.
prompt: Think of feeling full from a satisfying meal you had the day before.
fact: This sentence uses the past tense of '食べる' (taberu) to describe eating a lot in the past.

tts: きのう わ のみもの を たくさん  のみ まし た
english: I drank a lot of drinks yesterday.
prompt: Imagine remembering having enjoyed various drinks at an event the previous day.
fact: This sentence uses the past tense of '飲む' (nomu) to describe drinking a lot in the past.

tts: きのう わ たのし かっ た です
prompt: Think back to a pleasant and enjoyable experience you had yesterday.
fact: This sentence uses the past tense of the adjective '楽しい' (tanoshii) to describe yesterday.

tts: きょう わ パーティー でわ  あり ませ ん
prompt: Look around and notice that the current setting is not that of a party.
fact: This sentence uses the negative form 'ではありません' (dewa arimasen) to negate the existence of a party.

tts: きょう わ ともだち と あ い ませ ん
english: I will not meet friends today.
prompt: Check your schedule and confirm that you have no plans to meet friends today.
fact: This sentence uses the negative form of the verb '会う' (au - to meet) to indicate no meeting will occur.

tts: きょう わ たべもの を たくさん  たべ ませ ん
english: I will not eat a lot of food today.
prompt: Imagine sticking to a light meal plan for the day, perhaps for dietary reasons.
fact: This sentence uses the negative form of '食べる' (taberu) to express the intention of not eating a lot.

tts: きょう わ のみもの を たくさん  のみ ませ ん
english: I will not drink a lot of drinks today.
prompt: Think of choosing to limit your beverage intake for the day, perhaps for health reasons.
fact: This sentence uses the negative form of '飲む' (nomu) to indicate the intention of not drinking a lot.

tts: きょう わ つまら ない です
prompt: Imagine a day with no exciting plans, feeling dull and uneventful.
fact: This sentence expresses a feeling of boredom with the current day.

tts: あした わ パーティー で ともだち と あ っ て 、 たべもの を たくさん  たべ て 、 のみもの を たくさん  のん で 、 たのしい です
english: Tomorrow will be fun, meeting friends at a party, eating a lot of food, and drinking a lot of drinks.
prompt: Imagine a fun-filled day tomorrow, starting with a party where you meet friends, enjoy delicious food, and have a variety of drinks.
fact: This sentence uses multiple verbs connected by 'て' to describe a sequence of actions that will make tomorrow fun.

tts: きのう わ パーティー で ともだち と あ っ て 、 たべもの を たくさん  たべ て 、 のみもの を たくさん  のん で 、 たのし かっ た です
english: Yesterday was fun, meeting friends at a party, eating a lot of food, and drinking a lot of drinks.
prompt: Think back to a party you attended yesterday where you met friends, enjoyed delicious food, and had a variety of drinks, making it a fun experience.
fact: This sentence uses the past tense to describe a sequence of actions that made yesterday fun.

tts: きょう わ パーティー でわ  あり ませ ん が 、 あした わ パーティー で ともだち と あ っ て 、 たべもの を たくさん  たべ て 、 のみもの を たくさん  のん で 、 たのしい です
english: Today is not a party, but tomorrow will be fun, meeting friends at a party, eating a lot of food, and drinking a lot of drinks.
prompt: Acknowledge that today is ordinary, but anticipate a fun party tomorrow with friends, delicious food, and drinks.
fact: This sentence contrasts a boring today with an exciting tomorrow filled with party activities.
